name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 12, it was reported online that the accounts of riders who participated in the protest were banned on the grounds of "unreasonable interference with operating order." According to platform rules, riders who organize, incite, or participate in strikes, sit-ins, and other acts that interfere with the order of government agencies, enterprises, and social order will be punished by restrictions on receiving orders.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Hangzhou West Lake Police issued a police report
A male deliveryman named Wang was stopped by security guards because he stepped on the railing and broke it during the delivery process. He knelt down because he was worried about affecting other orders, which caused a crowd to gather. Currently, the people involved are being investigated according to law, and will be dealt with according to law in the future based on the investigation results.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A Henan netizen said that he spent 100,000 yuan to ask a relative to buy a job as a toll collector on a highway, with a monthly salary of 2,000 to 3,000 yuan. The central enterprise promised that he would work 6 days and rest 6 days, but in fact, he worked 7 days and rested 2 days. And his colleagues were also deceived in this way.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On Xiaohongshu, medical staff from all over the country reported salary cuts

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/HgdbSpZEct

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In the early morning of the 13th, orders for ghost money continued to be placed and delivered to the security room of the residential complex where the Hangzhou deliveryman protested today.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/mtYnf00T1y

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/oW9aK0fwza

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizens from all over the country shared their experiences of being urged to find a job by various communities after receiving unemployment benefits.
A netizen from Qingdao said that he had not received unemployment benefits for three months.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 13, Meituan Waimai responded that in the Hangzhou deliveryman protest, the company did not take any negative measures against any riders, such as banning their accounts or restricting orders.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 12, CCTV News titled the United States "The American Doping Country" to question the doping scandal in the Paris Olympics.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 12, economist Guan Qingyou advised everyone: "During the garbage time of history, you must have a sense of relaxation."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 12, according to the South China Morning Post, Beijing admitted that it was a Chinese ship that damaged the Baltic gas pipeline between Finland and Estonia in October 2023. It also said that it was an accident and the accident was caused by a strong storm.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 12, due to the lack of blood donation, Anhui Huaiyuan allocated free blood donation quotas to the system

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of August 12, a deliveryman threw paper money outside the community.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 13, Guangzhou, Guangdong. The Panyu District Police Station issued a notice: A woman has been detained for insulting and defaming Chinese national athletes and coaches on an online social platform.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 12, Guangzhou. Residents of Shaxi Village in Panyu resist forced demolition.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Today in history: 
On this day in 1958, People's Daily: "The best field in the world appeared in the Jianguo Commune of Macheng, with an early rice yield of more than 36,900 kilograms per mu"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A demolition compensation plan document for Hengyang County, Hengyang City has been leaked. The document shows that for houses with load-bearing parts made of reinforced concrete structures and a floor height of more than 4 meters, the compensation standard is only 1,400 yuan per square meter.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 12, Beijing. An officer from the Southern Theater Command came to the Beijing Petition Bureau to file a complaint. The officer said, "I have reported it to each level, but none of them will accept it! It is useless to go to the procuratorate or the court, as they will not accept it."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 13, Paris. When the blogger "Instructor Zhang's Interesting Life" and his group checked into the Evergreen Laurel International Hotel, they found that the hotel did not hang the Chinese flag. So the man told the front desk that they had a ready-made Chinese flag and asked if they could hang it up. However, the front desk refused and said that he had no right to make a decision. The blogger then checked out.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 13, the Dalian Center for Disease Control and Prevention issued a reminder: There has been an increase in domestic new coronavirus infection cases. It is recommended to wear masks or maintain social distance to reduce the risk of transmission of respiratory diseases.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, Great Wall Motors sued six self-media bloggers, with the total compensation amount reaching 25 million yuan, with the main reason being suspected insult and defamation.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 12, Jiayuguan, Gansu. A veteran posted a video to report the Jiayuguan scenic spot because the scenic spot introduction has Japanese words "Are there many Japanese tourists in Jiayuguan? Is it worth translating for them? I don't understand, I'm very angry." The scenic spot said, "This kind of Buddhist scenic spot in Asia will have more tourists from South Korea and Japan."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
A blogger posted a video saying that he went to Hangzhou on the evening of the 12th, and was stopped by the police as soon as he got off the train, and was reminded not to participate in the Hangzhou takeaway protest.
Then he received a call from the Shanghai police in the early morning, asking if he had been to Hangzhou.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 11, Liu Kunwen, a host with 4 million followers, had her Douyin account banned. It is reported that before this, Liu Kunwen had repeatedly exposed the problems of Meituan's excessive commission and insufficient protection for riders, but in the end these videos were deleted by the platform one after another.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 13, a personnel change notice of Beijing Yongzhe Law Firm was circulated online, showing that lawyer Yi Shenghua, who previously posted a post exposing the corpse trading case, resigned from the position of director of the law firm. 
His Weibo authentication information has not changed at present.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 4, Hangzhou, Zhejiang. A netizen posted that the Yuhang District Housing Provident Fund Center was recruiting three non-staff personnel, but more than 100 people came to take the exam. The netizen said that "1:100 ratios are common in small counties."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 12, Qingdao, Shandong. An old man ran behind a sprinkler truck holding a water pipe under the scorching sun. The urban management responded, "We are investigating and will remind people not to do this."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 12, Xianyang, Shaanxi. A netizen named "She's Burning Fool" posted that her father was the deputy director of Xianyang Architectural Design Institute and was detained by the local Municipal Supervision Committee in 2022 for taking bribes. However, "She's Burning Fool" believed that the authorities' accusations were false, and her mother committed suicide by jumping off a building because she could not tolerate the illegal evidence collection. She cried out for injustice online and was summoned by the police on suspicion of provoking trouble.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 11, a judge of the Beijing No. 3 Intermediate People's Court said: "Workers have the right to refuse unreasonable workloads" and was ridiculed by many netizens.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 13, in Binzhou City, Shaanxi Province, the owners of the Western International Plaza gathered together to protest for their rights because the property was not delivered. During the protest, the owners sang "Singing the Motherland" on the spot.
